p: Antibacterial activity was examined by the agar disc diffusion method [ 47]. Bacteria were first grown on Mueller Hinton plates at 37 °C for 18–24 h prior to inoculation onto the nutrient agar. Bacterial suspensions were prepared in saline water and adjusted to 0.5 McFarland turbidity standards with a DENSIMAT (Bio-merieux, Marcy-l’Étoile, France).
